text: Later the Moabites and Ammonites, along with some of the Meunites, attacked Jehoshaphat.

Messengers<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0935" class="">arrived</st> and <st data-num="05046 0559">reported</st> to <st data-num="03092" class="">Jehoshaphat</st>, “A <st data-num="07227" class="">huge</st> <st data-num="01995" class="">army</st> is <st data-num="0935 05921">attacking</st> you from the <st data-num="05676" class="">other side</st> of the Dead <st data-num="03220" class="">Sea</st>,<n id="2" /> from the direction of <st data-num="0123" class="">Edom</st>.<n id="3" /> <st data-num="02009" class="">Look</st>, they are in <st data-num="02688" class="">Hazazon Tamar</st> (<st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> is, <st data-num="05872" class="">En Gedi</st>).”
Jehoshaphat was afraid, so he decided to seek the Lord’s advice. He decreed that all Judah should observe a fast.
The people of Judah assembled to ask for the Lord’s help; they came from all the cities of Judah to ask for the Lord’s help.
Jehoshaphat stood before the assembly of Judah and Jerusalem at the Lord’s temple, in front of the new courtyard.
He prayed: “O Lord God of our ancestors, you are the God who lives in heaven and rules over all the kingdoms of the nations. You possess strength and power; no one can stand against you.

Our <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>, <st data-num="03808 0859">you</st> <st data-num="03423" class="">drove out</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="03427" class="">inhabitants</st> of <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> your <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> and <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> it <st data-num="05769" class="">as a permanent possession</st><n id="2" /> to the <st data-num="02233" class="">descendants</st> of your <st data-num="0157" class="">friend</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="085" class="">Abraham</st>.

They <st data-num="03427" class="">settled down</st> in it and <st data-num="01129" class="">built</st> in it a <st data-num="04720" class="">temple</st><n id="1" /> to <st data-num="08034" class="">honor</st> you,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">saying</st>,

‘<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> <st data-num="07451" class="">disaster</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">comes</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> us in the form of <st data-num="02719" class="">military attack</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="08196" class="">judgment</st>, <st data-num="01698" class="">plague</st>, or <st data-num="07458" class="">famine</st>, we will <st data-num="05975" class="">stand</st> in <st data-num="06440" class="">front</st> of <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> you, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> <st data-num="08034" class="">you</st> are present in <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>.<n id="2" /> We will <st data-num="02199" class="">cry out</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you <st data-num="02199" class="">for help</st> in our <st data-num="06869" class="">distress</st>, so that you will<n id="3" /> <st data-num="08085" class="">hear</st> and <st data-num="03467" class="">deliver</st> us.’

<st data-num="06258" class="">Now</st> the <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonites</st>, <st data-num="04124" class="">Moabites</st>, and men from <st data-num="02022" class="">Mount</st> <st data-num="08165" class="">Seir</st> are <st data-num="02009" class="">coming</st>!<n id="1" /> When <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> from the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>, you did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">allow</st> them to <st data-num="0935" class="">invade</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">these lands</st>.<n id="2" /> They <st data-num="03588 05493 05921">bypassed</st> them and did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="08045" class="">destroy</st> them.

<st data-num="02009" class="">Look</st> how <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> are <st data-num="01580 05921">repaying</st> us! They <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> to <st data-num="01644" class="">drive</st> us <st data-num="01644" class="">out</st> of our <st data-num="03425" class="">allotted land</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> you <st data-num="03423" class="">assigned</st> to us!
Our God, will you not judge them? For we are powerless against this huge army that attacks us. We don’t know what we should do; we look to you for help.”
All the men of Judah were standing before the Lord, along with their infants, wives, and children.
Then in the midst of the assembly, the Lord’s Spirit came upon Jachaziel son of Zechariah, son of Benaiah, son of Jeiel, son of Mattaniah, a Levite and descendant of Asaph.

He said: “Pay attention, all you people of Judah, residents of Jerusalem, and King Jehoshaphat! This is what the Lord says to you: ‘Don’t be afraid and don’t panic because of this huge army! For the battle is not yours, but God’s.

<st data-num="04279" class="">Tomorrow</st> <st data-num="03381" class="">march down</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> them <st data-num="02005" class="">as</st><n id="1" /> they <st data-num="05927" class="">come up</st> the <st data-num="04608" class="">Ascent</st> of <st data-num="06732" class="">Ziz</st>. You will <st data-num="04672" class="">find</st> them at the <st data-num="05490" class="">end</st> of the <st data-num="05158" class="">ravine</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">in front of</st> the <st data-num="04057" class="">wilderness</st> of <st data-num="03385" class="">Jeruel</st>.

You will not fight in this battle. Take your positions, stand, and watch the Lord deliver you, O Judah and Jerusalem. Don’t be afraid and don’t panic! Tomorrow march out toward them; the Lord is with you!’”
Jehoshaphat bowed down with his face toward the ground, and all the people of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem fell down before the Lord and worshiped him.
Then some Levites, from the Kohathites and Korahites, got up and loudly praised the Lord God of Israel.

Early the next morning they marched out to the wilderness of Tekoa. When they were ready to march, Jehoshaphat stood up and said: “Listen to me, you people of Judah and residents of Jerusalem! Trust in the Lord your God and you will be safe! Trust in the message of his prophets and you will win.”

He met with the people and appointed musicians to play before the Lord and praise his majestic splendor. As they marched ahead of the warriors they said: “Give thanks to the Lord, for his loyal love endures.”
When they began to shout and praise, the Lord suddenly attacked the Ammonites, Moabites, and men from Mount Seir who were invading Judah, and they were defeated.

The <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonites</st> and <st data-num="04124" class="">Moabites</st> <st data-num="05975 05921">attacked</st> the <st data-num="03427" class="">men</st> from <st data-num="02022" class="">Mount</st> <st data-num="08165" class="">Seir</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="02763 08045">annihilated</st> them.<n id="2" /> When they had <st data-num="03615" class="">finished off</st> the <st data-num="03427" class="">men</st><n id="3" /> of <st data-num="08165" class="">Seir</st>, they <st data-num="05826" class="">attacked</st> and <st data-num="04889" class="">destroyed</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">one</st> <st data-num="07453" class="">another</st>.<n id="4" />

When the men of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0935" class="">arrived</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">at</st> the <st data-num="04707" class="">observation post</st> overlooking the <st data-num="04057" class="">wilderness</st> and <st data-num="06437" class="">looked</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">at</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="01995" class="">huge army</st>, they <st data-num="02005" class="">saw</st> <st data-num="06297" class="">dead bodies</st> <st data-num="05307" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">ground</st>; <st data-num="0369" class="">there were no</st> <st data-num="06413" class="">survivors</st>.

Jehoshaphat and his men went to gather the plunder; they found a huge amount of supplies, clothing, and valuable items. They carried away everything they could. There was so much plunder, it took them three days to haul it off.
On the fourth day they assembled in the Valley of Berachah, where they praised the Lord. So that place is called the Valley of Berachah to this very day.
Then all the men of Judah and Jerusalem returned joyfully to Jerusalem with Jehoshaphat leading them; the Lord had given them reason to rejoice over their enemies.
They entered Jerusalem to the sound of stringed instruments and trumpets and proceeded to the temple of the Lord.
All the kingdoms of the surrounding lands were afraid of God when they heard how the Lord had fought against Israel’s enemies.
Jehoshaphat’s kingdom enjoyed peace; his God made him secure on every side.
Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah. He was thirty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned for twenty-five years in Jerusalem. His mother was Azubah, the daughter of Shilhi.
He followed in his father Asa’s footsteps and was careful to do what the Lord approved.
However, the high places were not eliminated; the people were still not devoted to the God of their ancestors.
The rest of the events of Jehoshaphat’s reign, from start to finish, are recorded in the Annals of Jehu son of Hanani, which are included in the Scroll of the Kings of Israel.
Later King Jehoshaphat of Judah made an alliance with King Ahaziah of Israel, who did evil.

They <st data-num="02266 05973">agreed</st><n id="1" /> to <st data-num="06213" class="">make</st> <st data-num="08659" class="">large</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">seagoing</st> <st data-num="08659" class="">merchant</st> <st data-num="0591" class="">ships</st>;<n id="2" /> they <st data-num="06213" class="">built</st> the <st data-num="0591" class="">ships</st> in <st data-num="06100" class="">Ezion Geber</st>.

Eliezer son of Dodavahu from Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat, “Because you made an alliance with Ahaziah, the Lord will shatter what you have made.” The ships were wrecked and unable to go to sea.
